episodes.title: "He is appalled by the allegations" | King's biographer on Andrew and Epstein
episodes.description:
King Charles's biographer and friend Jonathan Dimbleby tells BBC Newsnight's Katie Razzall that he "would strongly believe" that the monarch "would very much like" his brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor to testify in the US in relation to convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. Interview broadcast on Friday 13th February 2026.

When asked whether the King would be feeling "pressure" over the allegations, Dimbleby said: "I think that he will be feeling the pain of this" and be "appalled by the allegations".

Dimbleby added that Charles would be "sensing the need to give duty of care" to Mountbatten-Windsor, describing Andrew as "a broken, finished man at best".

Last week, Buckingham Palace said it was ready to support the police as they consider allegations against Mountbatten-Windsor. 

Mountbatten-Windsor has consistently and strenuously denied any wrongdoing.

#newsnight #bbcnews #katierazzall #andrewmountbattenwindsor #andrew #kingcharles #kingcharlesiii #royalfamily #dimbleby #jonathandimbleby #andrew #epstein #jeffreyepstein #epsteinfiles

episodes.title: Pressure on the Palace
episodes.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor faces another accusation of sharing an official document, with reports that he gave a Treasury briefing to one of his personal business contacts. Historian and friend of King Charles, Jonathan Dimbleby, talks to Newsnight about where the mounting pressure leaves the monarchy. With Katie Razzall.

episodes.title: “The damage it may do to Charles’s legacy” | The Royals, Epstein files & Andrew questions
episodes.description:
Royal commentator Peter Hunt and the Financial Times's Gillian Tett discuss the growing pressure on Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor to testify in the US in relation to the Epstein files. The pair also discuss the response of the Royal Family. Interview by Victoria Derbyshire, with Newsnight Political Editor Nick Watt.

Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has always denied any wrongdoing.

episodes.title: Labour MP's reaction to Peter Mandelson's links with Epstein | BBC Politics Live
episodes.description:
Labour MP Natalie Fleet, a survivor of grooming, has told the BBC's Politics Live that “until we believe victims, nothing will change”. 

The MP for Bolsover was responding to recent developments surrounding former British ambassador to the US, Peter Mandelson, and his links to convicted paedophile, Jeffrey Epstein.

“This horrendous story about Epstein has been told through the lens of men by men,” Fleet said, adding that this needs to change.

She was joined in the studio by Conservative MP Lewis Cocking and Camilla Tominey from The Telegraph. 

Read more on this story on the BBC News website: https://bbc.in/3ZPDaiW
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#UKPolitics #BBCNews

episodes.title: Giuffre memoir co-writer on how Andrew, the King and Maxwell are responding to the Epstein files
episodes.description:
Amy Wallace, co-author of Virginia Giuffre's memoir 'Nobody's Girl', speaks to Newsnight about the prospect of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor testifying before the US Congress in relation to the Epstein files. The author also discusses the King's most recent statement about his brother Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell's refusal to answer questions from Congress about Jeffrey Epstein. Interview by Victoria Derbyshire.

Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has always denied any wrongdoing.

Green Party leader Zack Polanski, Labour MP Barry Gardiner and former Northern Ireland First Minister Baroness Foster discuss the challenges facing the Prime Minister. Presented by Paddy O'Connell, with Newsnight Political Editor Nick Watt.

Lord Mandelson has not responded to requests for comment, but the BBC understands his position is that he has not acted in any way criminally and that he was not motivated by financial gain.

episodes.title: PM Keir Starmer apologises to victims of Jeffrey Epstein | BBC News
episodes.description:
PM Keir Starmer has apologised to Jeffrey Epstein's victims and "sorry for having believed Mandelson's lies and appointing him"
 
The prime minister said he wanted to release the files relating to the appointment of Lord Mandelson as US ambassador "as quickly as possible" but said it is against police advice, because it could "prejudice future investigations or legal processes".
 
Starmer is facing mounting pressure from his own Labour MPs over the process that led to Mandelson's appointment.
 
Read more on this story on the BBC News website: https://bbc.in/4c9eBEW 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#UKPolitics #BBCNews

episodes.title: "Appalling behaviour" | Emily Thornberry & Stephen Flynn on Mandelson & Epstein email allegations
episodes.description:
The Met Police says it is reviewing reports of alleged misconduct in a public office after emails suggest Peter Mandelson forwarded internal government information to Jeffrey Epstein when he was business secretary in 2009. Labour MP Emily Thornberry, SNP MP Stephen Flynn and tax expert and journalist Dan Neidle discuss the allegations facing Peter Mandelson. Presented by Victoria Derbyshire with Political Editor Nick Watt.

On 1 February 2026, Lord Mandelson reiterated his regret for "ever having known Epstein" and for continuing his association following Jeffrey Epstein's conviction. The BBC has approached Lord Mandelson for further comment.

episodes.description:
Anouska De Georgiou, who was a friend of Virginia Giuffre and the first British woman to allege she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein, responds to King Charles' decision to strip Andrew Mountbatten Windsor of his "prince" title and calls for President Trump to "take a leaf out of King Charles' book" and release the Epstein files in full. She also says she has faced a number of threats since waving her right to anonymity in 2019. Interview by Matt Chorley.

Andrew Mountbatten Windsor denies all of the allegations made against him.

episodes.title: British Jeffrey Epstein accuser on the legacy of Virginia Giuffre and coping with trauma
episodes.description:
WARNING: Contains mentions of abuse.

In a UK exclusive TV interview, Victoria Derbyshire speaks to a British woman who accused paedophile Jeffrey Epstein of sexually abusing her over several years. Anouska De Georgiou is a former model and actor who testified in court in 2019  in a special hearing by a US judge to allow victims their chance to be heard, after Epstein took his own life. Anouska was a close friend of Virginia Giuffre. Ms Guifree accused Prince Andrew and Jeffrey Epstein of sexual abuse, and died by suicide in April, aged just 41. 

Virginia Giuffre claimed Prince Andrew had sexually assaulted her on three occasions when she was 17, allegations he has repeatedly denied. The Prince settled a civil sexual assault case brought against him in the US by Virginia Giuffre. The out-of-court settlement said the Duke - who made no admission of liability - would pay an undisclosed sum to Ms Giuffre. Prince Andrew said in an interview with this programme that he had no recollection of ever meeting Ms Giuffre.

Ms De Georgiou talks to Victoria about the legacy of Virgina Giuffre. She is also joined by physician and author Gabor Maté to the discuss trauma and living with its impacts.

Newsnight is the BBC's flagship news and current affairs TV programme - with analysis, debate, exclusives, and robust interviews.

episodes.title: Virginia Giuffre's family call for Duchess of York to be stripped of royal title
episodes.description:
The family of Virginia Giuffre, one of the most prominent accusers of Jeffrey Epstein, has spoken out in an emotional interview with BBC Newsnight, calling for the Duchess of York, Sarah Ferguson, to lose her royal title after revelations emerged that she had privately apologised to Epstein and referred to him as a “supreme friend.” The interview follows the news that several charities in the UK and US have severed ties with the Duchess after the leaked email came to light. Epstein, a convicted paedophile, had already been found guilty at the time the email was sent. 

Interview by Faisal Islam.

episodes.title: QAnon: The conspiracy theory spreading fake news - BBC Newsnight
episodes.description:
Twitter has become the first social media outlet to announce a crackdown on the QAnon conspiracy theory, banning thousands of accounts and blocking web addresses linking to videos and websites spreading it. But what is QAnon and what do its followers believe? Subscribe to our channel here: https://goo.gl/31Q53F

At its heart, QAnon is a wide-ranging, unfounded conspiracy theory that says that Donald Trump is waging a secret war against elite Satan-worshipping paedophiles in government, business and the media.

QAnon believers have speculated that this fight will lead to a day of reckoning where prominent people such as Hillary Clinton will be arrested and executed.

It may sound outlandish, but it hasn't stopped President Trump himself retweeting tweets from accounts supporting the theories - and those in his circle have posted imagery linked to the group. Since the coronavirus pandemic took hold in the US in March there's been a surge in online QAnon groups. 

As the US gears up for its presidential election in November, BBC Population Correspondent Stephanie Hegarty and producer Emma Ailes have been taking a deeper look into Q-Anon. 

#BBC #Newsnight #BBCNews

Newsnight is the BBC's flagship news and current affairs TV programme - with analysis, debate, exclusives, and robust interviews. 

Website: https://www.bbc.co.uk/newsnight
Twitter: https://twitter.com/BBCNewsnight
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnewsnight

episodes.title: How much trouble is Jeffrey Epstein's death for the Royal Family? - BBC Newsnight
episodes.description:
Prince Andrew is appalled by sex abuse claims about his ex-friend Jeffrey Epstein, Buckingham Palace has said.
Subscribe to our channel here: https://goo.gl/31Q53F

It comes after the Mail on Sunday published footage that claimed to show the Duke of York inside the financier's Manhattan mansion in 2010 - two years after Epstein's first conviction.

A Buckingham Palace statement said: "The Duke of York has been appalled by the recent reports of Jeffrey Epstein's alleged crimes. His Royal Highness deplores the exploitation of any human being and the suggestion he would condone, participate in or encourage any such behaviour is abhorrent."

But what was the Duke of York doing at Epstein's house?

Jeffrey Epstein, 66, took his own life in a jail cell while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges in New York.

Kirsty Wark speaks to former BBC Royal Correspondent, Michael Cole.

Newsnight is the BBC's flagship news and current affairs TV programme - with analysis, debate, exclusives, and robust interviews.

episodes.description:
Katy Morgan-Davies was kept as a 'slave' by a Maoist cult leader for 30 years. She was born into the cult, didn't know who her parents were and even what mothers and fathers actually were.

Kirsty Wark takes her back to the house in Brixton, South London that she escaped from five years ago.

episodes.title: Steiner schools racism and bullying concerns revealed - Newsnight
episodes.description:
They've been popular for decades among the more liberal and bohemian - or some would say wacky - middle classes.  Sandra Bullock and Robin van Persie are both former students. But Newsnight has learned that complaints were made to the Department for Education - that in some of these privately funded schools teachers said they thought bullying was part of how kids "worked out their karma" - and in one school, there were problems with racism linked directly to the Steiner philosophy. But since the government received these complaints, it agreed to fund three new Steiner free schools. Chris Cook has the story

Follow @BBCNewsnight on Twitter
https://twitter.com/BBCNewsnight

Like BBC Newsnight on Facebook 
https://www.facebook.com/bbcnewsnight
